paper.title: Data Mining Corrections Testing in Chinese Stocks
paper.abstract: In this analysis of the risk and return of stocks in global and Chinese markets, we build a reasonably large number of models for stock selection and create optimized portfolios to outperform a global benchmark. We apply robust regression techniques in producing stock-selection models and Markowitz-based optimization techniques in portfolio construction in a global stock universe and two Chinese stock universes. We report the results of applying a data mining corrections test to the global and Chinese stock universes. We find that (1) robust regression applications are appropriate for modeling stock returns in global and Chinese stock markets; (2) mean-variance techniques continue to produce portfolios capable of generating returns that exceed transactions costs; and (3) our global portfolio selection models pass data mining tests, such that the models produce statistically significant asset selection for global and MSCI-China universes, but not for China A-shares.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要讨论了股票选择和投资组合优化，使用了Markowitz均值-方差优化技术来构建投资组合，并测试了其在全球和中国市场的表现，这明显属于投资组合管理的范畴。
